qas.question: Egyptianized Greeks in the Ptolemaic kingdom started to exist by which century?
Greeks adopted what from local cultures?

context: Despite their initial reluctance, the Successors seem to have later deliberately naturalized themselves to their different regions, presumably in order to help maintain control of the population. In the Ptolemaic kingdom, we find some Egyptianized Greeks by the <a1_0>2nd<a1_0/> century onwards. The Indo-Greek kingdom, we find kings who were converts to <a0_0>Buddhism<a0_0/> (e.g. Menander). The Greeks in the regions therefore gradually become 'localized', adopting local <a2_0>customs<a2_0/> as appropriate. In this way, hybrid 'Hellenistic' cultures naturally emerged, at least among the upper echelons of society.
